HomeAlone.business

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • HomeAlone.business.Creature
      • HomeAlone.business.Player

  • public class Player
extends Creature
    Class that contains the methods and attributes of players.

    • Method Detail

      • getInventory

        public java.lang.String getInventory()
        Returns a string of items that the player is carrying. This method returns a string containing the names of Item the player is carrying.
        Returns:
        a string of item names

      • placeTrap

        public boolean placeTrap(java.lang.String itemName)
        Sets a trap if it is possible. This method takes an item name and uses the method searchInventory(String itemName) to find the actual Item object that the item name refers to. Then it checks the Room to see if the Trap can be set there. If it can be set it uses the method setTrap(Item item) to set the trap and returns true. If it can not be set it returns false.
        Parameters:
        itemName - String
        Returns:
        true if Trap is set, false if not

      • pickupItem

        public boolean pickupItem(java.lang.String secondWord)
        Picks up an item from a Room and adds it the Players inventory. This method takes an item name as argument and calls the method Room.getRealItem(java.lang.String) to get the Item object. The method is used differently depending on phases. In phase 3 it checks for the special Usable item Phone, that is part of the conditions. It also checks if the Item found is a Trap as that can not be picked up once it is set. If it finds an Item it then calls the method addToInventory(Item item). If the Item is added to the inventory the method the returns true. If it is not added the method returns false.
        Parameters:
        secondWord - String
        Returns:
        true item is picked up, false if it is not picked up

      • dropCommand

        public boolean dropCommand(java.lang.String itemName)
        Drops an item. This method takes an item name, calls the method searchInventory(String itemName) and if it finds an Item it removes it from the players inventory using the method removeFromInventory(Item item) and adds it the inventory of the Room using Room.addItem(HomeAlone.business.Item).
        Parameters:
        itemName - String
        Returns:
        true if Item is dropped, false if it is not
